utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, anyway, last night on video chat, I spent, like, twenty minutes just staring into Lucy’s eyes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds romantic.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was until I realized the screen had frozen. Still one of my top three dates of all time.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, are we ever gonna hang out with this girl?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’d love that, but she’s not really comfortable around people.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I used to be uncomfortable around people, but then I learned a trick. I pretend everyone I meet is a beloved character from Star Trek.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How’s that been working for you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, like a charm, unnamed crewman in a red shirt.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, I may have gotten you a job.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have a job.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, he does. He caters to my every whim.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, in a couple of weeks, Stephen Hawking’s team is sending an expedition to the North Sea to test hydrodynamic simulations of black holes. One of their experimental physicists dropped out, and I recommended you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, do you really think I have a shot?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ve worked with Hawking. I talked you up. He knows your research. I think this could happen.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: He knows, wow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, now, but do you think that’s a good idea? Uh, you know Star Trek. Should a guy with no name and a red shirt really go on an expedition?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, don’t discourage him. This is a fantastic opportunity.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No one asked you, Uhura.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you like to hear a classic Sheldon Cooper factoid?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. I’ve been doing some reading about vehicular safety. Did you know that the highest number of drowning accidents happen on or around boats?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Interesting that you would bring that up when I might go work on a boat.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, that’s the thing about factoids, they’re interesting.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know what you’re doing. You don’t want me going on this research trip because you’re afraid to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not afraid to be alone. On land. On the sea, it would be terrifying. Because of all the drowning.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine, no more drowning talk. I’ll change the subject. Oh. Who do you think would win in a fight, you or a shark?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I appreciate your signature blend of concern for me and incredible selfishness. If I get the chance to do this, there is nothing you can say that’s going to stop me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. Things between you and Penny have never been better. I hope four months apart doesn’t change anything. I should have opened with that, huh?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you look carefully at Venus, you should be able to see the International Space Station pass by.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Wow. Your friend was actually up there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah. He brought me back a T-shirt that said My Friend Went to the Space Station and All I Got Was This Lousy T-Shirt

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Did he take the T-shirt to space?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nope. It’s exactly as lousy as advertised. Speaking of friends, they have been asking to meet you. I was thinking maybe we could all hang out sometime?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: I don’t know. How many are there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s see. Six. That’s pretty cool, I have six friends. Kind of like Sinatra.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Six strangers? That’s a lot of pressure. Staring at me, asking me personal questions. Like, what do you do? Where are you from? Why did you lock yourself in the bathroom?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, how about you just dip your toe in and meet one of them?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Will you be there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Well, that’s two. Three if you count me. Oh, this is getting out of hand.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, then, during my afternoon shift, I spilled an entire tray of drinks on myself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s awful.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not really. My shirt was soaking wet. I got, like, the biggest tip of my life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, listen, do you remember when I said the similarities of the equations of general relativity and hydrodynamics suggest you could find the equivalent of Unruh radiation in a large body of water?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I thought I said that to you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, Stephen Hawking’s team is looking into that, and I’ve been invited to join them.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow, Hawking. Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it is. Just, you know, I’d be gone for a while.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, how long?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Three, four months.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whoa. When would you leave?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow. Oh, okay, well, I’ll just come visit you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s the thing, you can’t. I’ll be on a ship in the North Sea.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: On a ship? Aren’t they afraid Hawking will just roll overboard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, he’s not gonna be there. He’s just sending a team to research his theory.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sure. Like when you send me to kill spiders in your bathtub. Wow. Okay. Four months.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. And I’m a little worried because things between us have been so great, and I’d hate to do anything that screws that up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, if you’re gonna screw things up, it’s gonna be while you’re here, not while you’re away. No. I mean, look, you have to go. It sounds like an amazing opportunity. And I’m just basing that on how much I didn’t understand what you said about it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll confirm the travel arrangements in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Good.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I do have to ask you one favour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon’s nervous about me leaving. Just keep an eye on him while I’m gone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. Remember what happened when I took care of your goldfish?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, flush Sheldon down the toilet and get me a new one.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really, you guys do not need to throw me a going-away party.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? How often can you say bon voyage to somebody when they’re actually going on a voyage?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hello, Rajesh.

utterance.speaker: Howard (in Raj accent)
utterance.content: Hello, Amy. Nice to see you. What can I say? It’s funnier with the accent.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s beer in the fridge. Anyway, you guys really don’t need to make a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, you’re being selfish. We need to give you a proper send-off so we’ll have closure when you die at sea and crabs eat your face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, sweetie, shut up.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, one of the things that helped me get through Howard being in space for so long was getting married before he left.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bernadette, sweetie, shut up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. I have a request to make.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And now he can talk. I want to cut open your brain and see what the heck’s going on in there.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: The only person allowed inside this head is Dr. Phil. Anyway, I, I spoke to my new lady friend about meeting you all, and she thought it would be easier for her to start with just one.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, gee, I don’t know. My schedule’s a little busy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, I was thinking Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you, Raj. I’d be honoured.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What the hell? I thought I was your best friend.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You are, but you’ve got kind of a big personality, with your flashy clothes and your Woody Allen swagger.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, maybe she’d be more comfortable meeting a girl first.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Good idea. Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you’re very pretty. That could be intimidating to another woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, you don’t think I’m pretty enough to scare your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Calm down, Bernie. You’re very scary.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It should be me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why? So you can make jokes about cutting open my brain?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A, that was not a joke, that was a sincere request. And B, more importantly, I was the outsider to this group, and I know how frightening that can be. But you guys took me in and made me feel loved, like I was family.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine, I’ll do it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, after I started dating Sheldon, I met Leonard, and then everybody else, and they’ve all been so wonderful to me.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: That’s really nice to hear.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe next week, we could all get together.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, Lucy, you don’t have to answer that. Don’t put her on the spot. She hates that. Am I right? Tell her how much you hate being put on the spot. Go ahead, tell her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ignore him. He’s a little nervous ’cause he doesn’t think I understand the severity of your social anxiety.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What the? Are you crazy? You can’t talk about social anxiety to someone who has social anxiety. It makes them socially anxious!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Excuse me, but I’m a neurobiologist. I think I’m a little more qualified than you to understand what’s not working in your girlfriend’s brain!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t call her my girlfriend. We haven’t discussed whether or not we’re girlfriend or boyfriend yet. Now that it’s out there, are you my girlfriend? By the way, if you say no, I’ll never be happy again. Not to put you on the spot.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: I think I have to go to the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We might as well go ahead and eat. She’s not coming back anytime soon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is ridiculous, we’re shopping for a party and this store doesn’t even have a party section.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it does, and here we are.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I have to say, Penny, I don’t understand why you of all people are encouraging Leonard to do this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I’m his girlfriend, of course I’m gonna support him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you’re his girlfriend for now. You know, maybe you’re not aware of this, but there is a rich tradition of men at sea finding comfort in each other’s arms and britches.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Honey, this is a big deal for Leonard, okay? He gets to work with Stephen Hawking. Who, by the way, will not be on the boat. I checked it out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s not that big of an opportunity. And even if Hawking’s theories are correct, all they prove is where the universe came from, why everything exists and what its ultimate end will be. I mean, me? I’m interested in the big questions.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, Sheldon the genius is jealous of Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not jealous. I’m just very unhappy that good things are happening for him and not happening for me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Look, sweetie, this is a natural thing to feel, okay? But just because good things are happening to Leonard doesn’t take anything away from you. You know what? Let me tell you a little story. Once there was a girl who worked at the Cheesecake Factory, and she wasn’t very good at her job.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It wasn’t me. But she was also an actress, and we were both up for the same part in a toothpaste commercial. She got it. Look, I was so jealous. But instead of ripping out her fake blonde hair…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You ripped out your own fake blonde hair.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I, looked her in the eye, smiled and said, I’m happy for you. Because that’s what friends do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: They lie so they don’t look petty.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Like this. I am so happy for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wow. No wonder you didn’t get that toothpaste commercial.

utterance.speaker: Raj (on skype)
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I want to apologize for Amy last night. She was completely out of line. Are you, are you not speaking to me or did the screen freeze again?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Amy wasn’t the problem.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay. I know. It was me. I, I pushed too hard. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, I, I’ve been thinking that maybe meeting somebody one-on-one is too intense, so Friday night, my friends are having a party.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: A party?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A little one. It’s, it’s a farewell for Leonard, so all the attention will be on him. If you wear something brown and sit on the couch, they won’t even know you’re there.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, please?

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on. Don’t make me beg. And I’m from India, so I know how to do it.

utterance.speaker: Lucy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, thank you! This means a lot to me. My friends are like my family. Unless you don’t like them, in which case, they’re dead to me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, have you ever spent a long time on a boat before?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you referring to the time we got stuck on the Small World ride at Disneyland?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m proud of you, Leonard. Working out on the North Sea for months, that’s really something.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. As far as science goes, this is the adventure of a lifetime.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe your lifetime. I went to space.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not a competition.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re right, you’re right. I’m really proud of you, and I’m gonna miss you when you’re gone. And space beats water.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Rajesh, I thought Lucy was coming.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: She is. She’s just running a little late. You know how it is, girls always fussing about their hair, their makeup. She’ll be here. Just give it a rest, okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, can I have your attention, everyone? That’s, uh, B-flat, for those who don’t have perfect pitch. I would like to propose a toast to my best friend, Dr. Leonard Hofstadter. He has been presented with a wonderful opportunity, and I couldn’t be happier for him.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon. That must’ve been very hard for you to say.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I mean it. I’m really happy for you. And that’s how you get a toothpaste commercial. Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was really nice of you to try to be happy for Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It must’ve killed you when I went to space.

utterance.speaker: Raj (Looking at phone)
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Buddy, you okay? Oh, man.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, go ahead. Read it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj, I can’t come to the party. This is all just too much for me. I don’t think we should see each other any more. Sorry. Lucy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Raj, I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It did not kill me when you went to space. Monkeys went to space.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, here we are.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yep. I’m really gonna miss you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m gonna miss you, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, we’re in the red zone. The white zone is for loading and unloading. We’re breaking the law.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, there’s no space in the white zone, so…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anyway, we can e-mail, and I think the phone connections are pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, you have to get out of the car right now. I’m not going to jail for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Would you just relax?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I see a space in the white zone. Quick, circle the airport.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Did you bring enough inhalers?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And, uh, extra Dramamine? You remember what happened on It’s a Small World.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m covered.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, dear Lord, a police officer’s glancing in our direction. We’ve been made.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Calm down. I’m getting out. I have something I want to give you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s just a heart-shaped locket with a picture of Leonard’s face in it. He got it at the mall on clearance. Now move, move, move.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t worry, Officer. They just love each other. We’re not smuggling drugs.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Raj, it’s Penny. Are you in there?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hang on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. I’m just coming back from the airport. I wanted to see how you’re doing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s, that’s very nice of you. Uh, come, come. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can’t stay long. I left Sheldon in the car with the window cracked open. He’s gonna go through that activity book in, like, 30 seconds, so… Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. It’s my fault. You know, I finally found someone who was right for me, and I, I drove her away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Penny, I, I miss her already.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I know how you feel. I miss Leonard, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What’s like, what is wrong with me? Why, why can’t I ever have love?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You will.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I, I won’t. I’m, I’m unlovable.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s just the booze talking.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, it’s not. I haven’t had a drink since last night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You’re talking to me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I am. And now I’m crying for a whole different reason!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So I guess what I’m saying is I get where Lucy’s coming from.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s great. Do you want some wine?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, no, water’s fine. Anyhow, I’ve been thinking about it a lot and, and I totally see why Lucy did what she did. I pushed too hard. But you know what? If I back off and give her enough space, maybe there’s still a future for us. Yeah, the funny thing about life is that, you know, sometimes…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Does he ever shut up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: … but then it turns good again, and that means it’s better than if it had never been bad for a while. I know that now, thing’s aren’t good, they are in fact very very bad but at least my heart is starting to heal. Slowly but surely. And oh how I cried. It was like a little, uh, thunderstorm on my face. But I’m a man, okay? So I need to pull myself together, pick up a pen and get it all out in my journal. I mean, it’s not all bad, right? Having my heart broken has allowed me to finally speak in front of you, so, you know, a silver lining….
